meanings.definition: To make a sudden, sharp cracking sound.
meanings.sent1: I heard a loud snap when the branch broke.
meanings.sent2: She likes to snap her fingers to music.
meanings.sent3: The snap of the pencil startled the class.
meanings.sent4: The ice snap echoed through the quiet forest.
meanings.sent5: The snap of the closing door made me jump.

meanings.sent1: The snap of the twig alerted the hiker.
meanings.sent2: The snap of the whip echoed in the arena.
meanings.sent3: The snap of the cookie broke the silence.
meanings.sent4: The snap of the bone made him wince.
meanings.sent5: The snap of the firewood filled the room.

meanings.definition: To break or cause to break suddenly and completely.
meanings.sent1: He tried to snap the stick in half.
meanings.sent2: The rope will snap if you pull too hard.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally snapped the pencil in two.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the air was about to snap.
meanings.sent5: The twig finally snapped under his weight.

meanings.definition: A quick, sudden movement or action.
meanings.sent1: With a snap, he caught the ball.
meanings.sent2: The snap of the door closing signaled his arrival.
meanings.sent3: The snap of the fingers got everyone's attention.
meanings.sent4: The snap of the lock broke the silence.
meanings.sent5: The snap of the trap caught the mouse.

meanings.definition: A photograph taken quickly and informally.
meanings.sent1: She took a snap of the beautiful sunset.
meanings.sent2: The family gathered for a quick snap.
meanings.sent3: The snap captured the joy of the moment.
meanings.sent4: The snap showed a candid moment of laughter.
meanings.sent5: The snap of the camera froze the memory in time.

meanings.definition: A fastening device that makes a clicking sound when closed.
meanings.sent1: She heard the snap of the lock securing the door.
meanings.sent2: The snap of the buckle echoed in the quiet room.
meanings.sent3: The snap of the button signaled the end of the show.
meanings.sent4: The snap of the clasp kept the necklace in place.
meanings.sent5: The snap of the latch confirmed the door was shut.

meanings.definition: To speak or utter something sharply or abruptly.
meanings.sent1: She would snap at anyone who interrupted her.
meanings.sent2: He tends to snap when he's stressed.
meanings.sent3: The teacher didn't mean to snap at the student.
meanings.sent4: He would snap out a response without thinking.
meanings.sent5: She would snap out orders without hesitation.
